All data which comes, brings TermId, if incoming TermId is bigger then current, Node updates its current termId toincoming Id and step back to the follower (if it was not). For vote and candidate requests
Must be called from lock_Operations only

member.summary: Normally must be UInt

member.name: P:Raft.Transport.cSprot1Parser.MaxPayLoad
member.summary: Restriction. Protocol supports 4 bytes data transfer inside of codec, but we can add extra restriction on maximum size inside of codec. Inside of tcpServer there is also receive buffer size. Default 2000000 bytes.

member.name: F:Raft.Transport.cSprot1Parser.MessageQueue
member.summary: It's a queue for incoming data

member.name: F:Raft.Transport.cSprot1Parser.DestroySelf
member.summary: In case if MaxPayLoad is overflowed this will be called

member.name: F:Raft.Transport.cSprot1Parser.packetParser
member.summary: Here will be receive parsed SPROT1 codecs

member.name: F:Raft.Transport.cSprot1Parser.PublishDequeued
member.summary: if this delegate is not null, parser after dequeuing procedure begins async invoke of the function and then goes on with parsing

member.name: F:Raft.Transport.cSprot1Parser.DeviceShouldSendAuthorisationBytesBeforeProceedCodec
member.summary: If device establishes a connection, this must be true, for the other device which answers it must be false, default true (as for the server)

member.name: F:Raft.Transport.cSprot1Parser.ProtocolExtensionLengthV1
member.summary: In one of versions we wanted to enhance Sprot1 with message id, like this {0;0} -auth {0;0}-codec {0;0;0;0} - length of payload {0;0} - messageId {0;0;...;0} - payload In this case message Id is an Extension, where to the length of payload will be added ProtocolExtensionLengthV1 (2 in our case) and the complete messageId+payload will be returned

member.name: F:Raft.Transport.cSprot1Parser.ToSendToParserAuthenticationBytes
member.summary: For the server side implementer, can be interesting to get inside of the parser first authentication bytes, it will be done if true second parameter for Packet Parser will be null in this case. Default is false.

member.name: F:Raft.Transport.cSprot1Parser.UseBigEndian
member.summary: By default Little Endian is used (First comes lower byte 0x01 in the end highest 0x08 = 2049)

member.name: F:Raft.Transport.cSprot1Parser.newPacketSize
member.summary: We can use maximum size of 2,147,483,647 only int not uint because we use fast substrings of bytes which can be used only with int parameter

member.name: F:Raft.Transport.cSprot1Parser.dId
member.summary: Device Id

member.name: P:Raft.Transport.cSprot1Parser.MyName
member.summary: For debugging purposes. Default is null

member.summary: Reinitialize Sprot instance after disconnection. In case if you don't want to create new instance for sure. Sets all technical variables back. Setting variables leaves in tact
